results.title: Lizzies of the field
results.creator_credit: Pathe Melody Comedies, Mack Sennett and Del Lord
results.brief_description: Two rival mechanics from competing garages, the Red Dog Garage and the Black Cat Garage, vie for the attention of the garage owner’s daughter. Their competition leads to them representing their respective garages in a 250 mile road race. Hijinks ensue as the villainous mechanic attempts to thwart the heroic mechanic. Features a spectacular multi-car pile up, some great stunts and lots of laughs. Cast includes Billy Bevan, Sidney Smith, Jack Lloyd, Barbara Pierce, John J. Richardson, Andy Clyde.

results.title: Lizzie's library: Possums don't wear boots
results.creator_credit: Henderson Bowman Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Queensland, Australian Film Commission, Phillip Bowman and Tim Adlide
results.brief_description: Lizzie’s Library is a delightful and informative series for young children set in the little Australian riverside town of Long Flat. Lizzie the librarian is back in this second video with her loveable dog BJ, her Murri co-worker Munro and her mobile library Booksy. Join Lizzie and her friends in nine more lively adventures. Narration and voice characterisation by Noni Hazelhurst.

results.title: Lizzie's library
results.creator_credit: Henderson Bowman Productions, ABC-TV (Australia), Film Queensland, Australian Film Commission, Phillip Bowman and Tim Adlide
results.brief_description: Lizzie, the Librarian, lives in the small Australian riverside town of Long Flat. Lizzie is always having adventures together with her loveable dog BJ, her Murri co-worker Munro and her Mobile Library Booksy. The moral of her many tales is that the answers to problems can often be found in a book! Narrated by Noni Hazlehurst, this puppet animation featuring nine stories will delight pre-schoolers.

results.brief_description: Documents the transformation of an old town near Glasgow into a modern city engineered to accommodate 100,000 people.

results.title: Living with the motor car
results.brief_description: A motor manufacturer, a surgeon, an architect and a town-planner discuss the problems posed by the demands of the motor vehicle. We study the way British cities have been reshaped to accommodate it, in Birmingham and Stevenage, and examine American and Swedish solutions in Los Angeles and Stockholm.

results.title: Living with the gun
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, David Hirst and Valerie Morton
results.brief_description: Shows interviews with people in Los Angeles affected by guns. Helen Vatsikopoulos discusses with David Hirst the making of this documentary and its relevance to the gun debate issue in Australia which is both complex and emotive.

results.title: Living with the city
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and David Muir
results.brief_description: Examines recent developments in the preservation and rehabilitation of inner-city areas of Sydney, Adelaide and Melbourne raising the issue of low-income workers being forced out of these areas by “trendies” and high class shops. Highlights the need to strengthen working relationships between inner-city communities and government emphasising the importance of deeper official understanding of residents’ social and environmental needs. Narrated by Leonard Teale.

results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Curriculum Branch, Stephen Skok and Ian Toohill
results.brief_description: Living with forests: The future of Leadbeater’s forest is the subject of a local enquiry. The viewer is asked to imagine that you are a member of the local community and give your views.

results.title: Living with dust
results.brief_description: Made for the Audio Visual Communications Centre, Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Co., the film presents causes of dust in nature and industry and gives methods of controlling these conditions. It tells how different dusts affect workers and what can be done to protect them.
